Class Ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • Sprite
      • Ball
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Ball
extends Sprite
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class inherits Sprite class and is serializable. It represents a ball and defines all its properties and additional attributes.
    Author:
    SHUBHAM THAKRAL, TANMAY BANSAL
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ball

        public Ball(int[] screenCoordinates)
        In the constructor, we take screenCoordinates and pass it to the super class constructor.
        Parameters:
        screenCoordinates - is an array of upper and lower bounds of the screen in XY plane. It is taken so that objects can know the boundaries of screen.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(double time)
        This defines the abstract method update of Sprite class by giving functionality to it. It updates the position X such that the object never moves out of frame.
        Specified by:
        update in class Sprite
        Parameters:
        time - is duration for which we want to update
